title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
OB: When invoking the New Java Package feature, a message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' appears at the top, even though the package name field is empty. There is confusion regarding the meaning of this message and whether it is an error. It is suggested to determine whether the message should be displayed in red with an error icon.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package feature, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear when the package name field is empty. Additionally, it should be clarified whether this message is an error and, if so, consider displaying it in red with an error icon.
SR: To reproduce the issue, invoke the New Java Package feature and ensure that the package name field is empty. Observe the appearance of the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' at the top.
